fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3209].
  {panel}

Dear Experts,

I am using JIRA 6.4.12 and installed JIRA Service Desk plugin version 2.5.9.
email configuration also setup but when we send emails to create requests, no requests are created in service desk and we are not receive any email notifications.

Kindly help on priority. If we can't resolve this issue, desperately we we have to go with other support tool.

I am much interested to use JIRA Service Desk, so kindly help us.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Email Setup Not working

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3207].
  {panel}

On a mobile device:
# ensure you're logged out of ecosystem.atlassian.net
# visit https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/mobile#issue/SAL-312
# BUG: you get an error page
# expected: you get a "not found" page or the proper mobile issue page

This looks to be caused by service desk, so I've filed it under that project.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3206].
  {panel}

Hi,
In our service desk project an agent get the issue and sometimes he handle it by creating external issue to other jira project, the SD issue change the status to pending external and the external issue has link to the SD issue.
Today, all the collaborators have browse permission to all SD issues.
What we would want is the collaborators to have browse permission only to the SD issues that have link to project in which the collaborators have browse permission.
Is it possible? Do you have something like it? Or maybe you have other suggestion that can help us to prevent from collaborators to see issues that are not related to them.
fields.summary: Collaborators can only see SD issue that are link to project which related to them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3205].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When connecting a Service Desk project to a HipChat room, if we filter the configuration to issue types, operations carried out by customers are not generating notifications in HipChat.

It still works with agents or when there's no filter.

h3. Environment
* HipChat Cloud.
* Tested in 7.1.0-OD-02-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project with an issue type, say ‘IT Help’
# Connect with HipChat
# Set a room to be notified on comments in the project and filter by ‘IT Help’
!hc_config.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue of type ‘IT Help’
# Log in as an agent and comment on the issue
# Log in as a customer and comment on the issue

h3. Expected Results
Both comments generate a notification in HipChat.

h3. Actual Results
Only the comment made by the agent generates notifications.
 
h3. Notes
This is similar to this bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/HCPUB-38

However, that bug seems to happen regardless of filter and it’s created for JIRA Server and HipChat Server.

h3.Workaround
*Partial Workaround*
Set issue types match to all.
fields.summary: HipChat room is not notified for customer operation if Service Desk project filters by issue type

At the moment we can see internal comments based on the little label in the upper right side of the the comment.

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk incoming mail handlers have pre-configured rules that prevent them from processing automatically generated messages (e.g. auto-responses or delivery status bounces), to avoid mail loops.
h3. Suggested Solution
To be able to create issues from automatically generated emails with configuration to switch of auto response to avoid mail loops.

  {panel}

Currently we use a ticketing system that allows us to reply to emails, CC and BCC customers.

I cannot seem to do this in JSD due to the following:

- There is no CC/BCC field
- There is no ability to add additional requestors who are not users in the system
- There is no ability to add watchers or request participants who are not users in the system.

Is there something I am missing?  We often send outage notifications out to customers, CC a companies tech along side the original requesters etc. etc.

I do not wish to add accounts for every single person I want to email, have them sent multiple emails asking them to create accounts, being added as participants along side the original correspondence.

What is the solution to this or am I using the wrong software?
fields.summary: Complete email gateway replacement

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
The Notification Email Subject for comment event only include Issue Key.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk Project.
# Raise a request as a Customer with a legit Email Address.
# Assign the ticket to an Agent.
# Let the Agent comment on the ticket.
# Wait for the Email Notification to sent to the Customer/Reporter mail inbox

h3. Expected Result:
- The Notification email will include the Issue Key and Issue Summary on its subject.

h3. Actual Result:
- The Notification Email did not include Issue Summary.

h3. Notes:
- Based on the [Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-0-0-release-notes-770801761.html] there is no statement about the details about Mail Template changes.
- As in version prior to JSD 3.x the summary is included, it could be said that it is a regression for this version.
- There is a customer that rely on the Issue Key and Issue Summary of the Mail Notification to do other operation.
fields.summary: Issue Summary missing from the Subject Email Notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3187].
  {panel}

At the moment there are three actions in utomation: transition issue, add comment and alert user. I'd like to suggest adding actions that can edit the issue. It would be great to have an action that could edit the request type, add a tag or system, add watchers, etc.

Use case:
We are currently in the process of adopting Service Desk for inhouse use (customers are coworkers, IT department of the company) and while the customer portal will work nicely for the more complicated issues but we expect the majority of tickets will come in via email. To reduce administration work (ie every ticket via email would have to be given a priority, systems/components added, etc) I'd want to do all this with automation.

I'm aware there is the possibility of adding custom actions by developing a plugin for automation, but I think editing some properties of issues should be a default option.
fields.summary: Add Automation Actions that can edit/change issues

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3182].
  {panel}

Currently, when raising an issue via the portal, the "Customer Request Type" is set automatically according to the type of issue created via the portal.

When viewing an issue created this way, the Service Desk request section shows:
Request Type: Service Request (for example)
Customer Status: Open (for example)
Channel: Portal

However, if a Service Desk Agent logs the request via the normal Jira interface, this is not set.

When viewing an issue created via Jira interface the Service Desk request section shows:
Request type:	No match
Channel:	JIRA

There is a pull-down menu which can be used to set the Request Type here.  In our configuration there is only ever 1 type of Request Type which is applicable to any particular issue type.  If this is the case, why not set it automatically.

Alternatively, expose the option to set the Request Type on the creation screen.
fields.summary: I want to be able to set the "Customer Request Type" manually when raising Service Desk ticket outside of Portal

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a JIRA Service Desk project's Knowledge Base is linked to a Confluence Space, the search feature that appears within the Customer Portal to find potential solutions through the KB does not provide autocomplete results unless a full word is entered. The search field displays {{Please enter at least 3 more characters}}, however unless the full word entered is three characters in length, the autocomplete feature does not provide any results until a full word is entered.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for partial word search when entering the first three+ characters of a word. This should also return mid-word results as well, assuming the characters entered are not the first three.

h3. Workaround
Type in a full word for the search
fields.summary: Add Support for Partial Word Search within the Customer Portal KB Search's Autocomplete Feature

How can we create a project that has both project types features?
Thank you

SLA metrics are shown in JIRA issues as "time for first to respond" and "time to resolve".
What I'd also like to see are two extra fields "SLA Calendar start" and "SLA Calendar end". 
These fields will represent the start and end times of the selected calendar for the specific project. 

This could help developers distinguish issues for their importance. Let's say two issues arrive where one project has a SLA agreement from 9am to 1pm where the other is from 9am to 5pm. If it's 3pm our developers should focus on the issue with the 9 to 5 agreement and leave the other for later.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3158].
  {panel}

Service desk does not send notification for transitions for the reporter, at the moment as stated on the documentation it only send notification on these cases:

- the request is created
- a comment is added to the request
- another participant is added to the request
- the request is resolved with a set resolution field
- the request is reopened with a cleared resolution field

We need to add a feature to send notifications for transitions created on workflows.

There isn't any workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Send notifications for transitions

fields.description:
h4. Summary:
Hitting Edit for *Service Desk enabled projects* in *IE 11* causes the browser to hang. Any other JIRA project issues work without issue.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Open any issue in *Service Desk Project* (from agent's issue view page)
# Click Edit
# JIRA will appear to be loading the edit screen, but will sit and spin on load.

h4. Error thrown
Activating the developer tool shows 
{code}
Unableto get property 'removeChild' of undefined or null reference
File: batch.js, Line: 149, Column: 394 
{code}
as shown in the screenshot below (IE11 Debug)

h4. Additional information:
Reproducible in IE 11 (Versions confirmed: 11.0.9600.18036, 11.0.10245.16590) only (but does work without issue in IE 11.0.9600.17728)
Does not happen with other versions of IE, or other browsers
Happens only to Service Desk Projects (other projects work fine)
Tested with JIRA 6.4.4 and JSD 2.5.6 and 2.5.9.

h4. Workaround
In the developer tool (Emulation)
- Change the *Document Mode* and *User Agent String* to other version of IE (such as IE 10) as shown below
!mode.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Edit screen does not load in IE11

h3. Summary

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3147].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever a customer sends an email to a Service Desk which has public signup enabled, the customer in question will receive an email back in order to proceed with the signup process for the Service Desk account.
In some use cases, the Service Desk environment should not be accessible for the customers, meaning that all issue communication should be running through email *alone*, and the customer essentially is not "aware" of having an account in the Service Desk environment.

h3. Suggested Solution
In order to prevent the customer from being aware an account has been created, the reply mail that gets sent whenever a first request has been raised should not be sent out by Service Desk. Please make this a configurable option for administrators.
fields.summary: As and administrator, I want to be able to disable the reply mail when a non existing user creates an issue through mail

  {panel}

Submitting a request on behalf of customer:

Satisfaction Feedback is a way we measure how satisfied the customer with the service and to improve the Service levels. In a common scenario, here is how it works:
# Customer send an email for some enquiries
# Support engineer pick it up and answer all the questions
# Once all question answered, the ticket is closed/resolved
# System sends Satisfaction Feedback through an email to customer to see how happy they are with the service

{quote}
Until step 4 we are good.
1. Customer wants to review / update the rating he has provided for
whatever reason
2. Customer wants to see ratings of the closed tickets
{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to review the Satisfaction Feedback and update it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3138].
  {panel}

As a project admin, I'd like to be able to manage the "smarts" pre-populated texts on the comment section of an issue when an agent responds to a customer. 

When talking about manage, I mean:
- Set myself a default message.
- Set specific messages for each project.
- Enable/disable this feature as I like.

*Workaround to disable*

Enable the following dark feature from https://<instance-url>/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa: (in Cloud Atlassian Support will need to do this)

{noformat}
sd.email.conversational.notification.disabled
{noformat}


{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 12 October 2015}
Hi all,

We have added an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the 3.0.1, 3.1.0-OD-01 release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}

{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 4 September 2015}
Hi all,

Thank you for all your feedback. Before launching this new feature, our goal was to make service desk notification more conversational. We’ve made a decision to move forward with helping agents save time with a friendly greeting and sign off with the agent name to make it more personal. We acknowledge that this functionality isn't for every agent and your desire to customize these responses.
So far we've added additional translation strings for German, French and Japanese. 
You can also help us in translating for your language here if it is missing https://translations.atlassian.com/. 
The string are:

{noformat}
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.greeting=Hi {0},
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.anonymous.greeting=Hi,
{noformat}

The ability to edit these responses will require a bit more thought, the immediate action for us is to provide an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the upcoming release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.If you have further questions or comments, please feel free to contact me directly as well at jhuynh at atlassian dot com.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow admins to manage pre-populated texts on JSD.

When the same userkey appears in 2 different user directories, and those 2 users have different group access, it can sometimes not be possible to assign that user to an issue (as can not be searched for in user picker).

*Steps to reproduce*

# Create 2 users in different user directories with same username (should also then be same userkey)
# The user within the directory id with lowest id (normally JIRA internal) is not a member of the service-desk-agents group
# The other user is a member of the group
# The group with highest id (probably not the JIRA Internal) is higher in order of priority
# Try to assign that user to a Service Desk issue that they should be an agent in

*Expected*

* The user can be assigned to the issue

*Actual*

* The user can not be found or assigned
fields.summary: Problem assigning a user to an issue when same userkey in 2 directories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The atlassian-jira.log file shows warning messages regarding automation rule events.
The error messages look as follows:
{code}
2015-11-24 17:49:52,539 http-bio-80-exec-21 WARN xxxxxx 1069x17411x1 1n8vwgx xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [execution.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:issue-created-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error com.atlassian.pocketknife.api.commons.error.ErrorMessage@b16ceeed
{code}

h3. Environment
These warning messages only show up in environments using Service desk.
The first version at which this has been reported is 2.5.4
 
h3. Notes
These log entries are warning messages, and do not indicate any actual issues or errors on the environment. The messages are a result of not properly handling and processing certain events, and subsequently printing in the log files.

As such, these warning messages can get ignored as these impose no threat on the environment.
fields.summary: Warning messages on automation rule events in the log file

fields.description:
If you drag and drop an attachment into an issue, you get the "add attachment screen" where you can write a comment and select if you want to share with the customer or internally only.

If the comment box in the issue is selected when you do this, the attachment is added to the issue without the screen popping up and its added to the comment with wiki markup (which does not work very well).

Adding attachments via the "Resolve Issue screen" does not work either as it is only viewable to internal JIRA-users and not in the customer portal (or via mail).

Please make this work the same way in all instances. There shouldnt even be a separate screen for this.

If you add an attachment, it should be viewable both in email to customer, in the customer portal and in the issue itself in JIRA (unless its an internal comment). Its a SERVICE DESK! It is supposed to communicate with customers, why are attachments restricted???
fields.summary: Attachment to customer-option "bug"

fields.description: The message threshold limit needs to be set to 0 in our configuration (otherwise we experience the BAD error described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/BAD+Command+Argument+Error+when+creating+issue+via+email+with+Microsoft+Exchange) I just upgraded JIRA from 6.4.1 to 6.4.2 and the threshold limit was reset to 5 which caused the error to return. I reported the same issue whenever a JIRA Service Desk upgrade was performed: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1747
fields.summary: JIRA upgrades reset the Message Threshold limit in the Advanced mail loop detection configuration

fields.description:
In JIRA it's possible for the user to set the 'Advanced mail loop detection' message Threshold to a custom setting.

However if JIRA is restarted, the default value of 5 is automatically put back. Any changes made by the user are lost.
The Domain setting is not affected.

*Before restart*
!before.png|thumbnail!

*After Restart*
!after.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA application restarts reset the Message Threshold in JIRA

h3. Problem Definition
It currently is not possible to change the log file location for Service Desk.
This causes issues when an environment with multiple applications require their log files to be centralized.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a similar option as available for the atlassian-jira.log file as described in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/logging-and-profiling-185729617.html] document 
h3. Workaround 
There currently is no workaround available to move the file in question
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to change the log file location of atlassian-servicedesk.log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3079].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA Service Desk sends an automatic email message when a support request is created

There is an improvement request for customizing this:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-218

JIRA Service Desk has the option to completely disable notifications, but not to only disable these notifications for request creation and keep the ones for updates in requests.

These notification messages are different from the others, as they contain a text message not customizable by administrators, so the users must receive those, regardless of the administration choice. Notification on updates in the issue, on the other hand, only show the modifications.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to prevent SD from sending these automatic replies for creating requests, but keep the customer notified on request updates.
fields.summary: Option to disable auto-reply on issue creation in Service Desk

h3. Summary
The "Linked issue matches" automation condition cannot be added 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new automation rule of type _Update incident when linked problem transitions_
# Edit the preexisting _Linked issue matches_ rule or add a new one

h3. Expected Results
One should be able to select options to match
h3. Actual Results
The following message appears: _{color:red}This condition could not be loaded.{color}_
And the following appears in the browser's console:
{code}Error rendering form s {cid: "c476", attributes: Object, collection: s, _changing: false, _previousAttributes: Object…}_changing: false_events: Object_listenerId: "l477"_listeners: Object_pending: false_previousAttributes: Objectattributes: Objectchanged: Objectcid: "c476"collection: s__proto__: r TypeError: n is not a function(…){code}
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to add the "Linked issue matches" condition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2978].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When a customer raises a Service Desk request, and the assigned agent creates a Knowledge Base article based on it, the article does not show up on the Open Requests page of the Portal.
This leads to unnecessary interactions between customer and agent. 


h3. Suggested Solution
 
Develop a solution where if a request has a newly created knowledge base article related to it, this article should show up on the customer request page.

h3. Workaround 

Current leaving a comment for the customer with a link to the article works.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk agent, I want the KB article I have created for a customer request to show up for that customer in a separate field on the customer portal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2974].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.x, under the "Service Desk" menu, we have an option to _Create Service Desk Request_, where we can create a Service Desk on behalf of a customer. We simply need to click there, select a project and then create the issue.

Now in JIRA 7 we don't have that option anymore. We need to click on _Projects > Service Desk_, select one Project and then click on the _Customer Portal_ option in the left menu.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can have a direct option to create a Service Desk, like we had in JIRA 6. Can be with the Service Desk menu back to the top OR a dropdown in the "Create" option, where we can select _Service Desk_ or _JIRA_ (not sure, but I believe we had this before in JIRA 7).

JIRA Service Desk 3.0.2
JIRA Software 7.0.0

h3.Potential Work-around
You might be able to create a direct link to the customer portal using the [Application Naviagator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-346948276.html] as an alternative.  I understand this isn't exactly the same functionality, however it would at least provide a link to service desk customer portal in the menu bar.
fields.summary: Create Service Desk Request option for JIRA 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2967].
  {panel}

Compared to the Automation plugin that only works on JIRA 6, the Automation built into Service Desk is worthless.  Please add all functionality from the v6 plugin into Service Desk 2.4+.  People need the ability to do more things to Issues than change the status.

Example of an automation rule I need to be able to make:
Once a ticket is opened, every 4 hours the priority goes up a level (I created priorities labelled 1 through 9) as long as the ticket is Open/In Progress and it's during normal business hours.  A comment is added to the Issue for each escalation and if the Issue reaches priority 9 an email is sent to the assigned Tech and his Manager.

Normal workflows and automation don't allow any of this to happen that I can see.
fields.summary: Automation Updates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2965].
  {panel}

*Summary:*

The migration hub does a great job on informing customers if they are migrating to JIRA 7, Service Desk, and Software. However in some cases we make a slight modification to improve the path for customers who already have JIRA 7 and simply want to add JIRA Service Desk or JIRA Software.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

When you navigate to the initial download link:

!jsinitial.png|thumbnail!
!jsdinitial.png|thumbnail!

Click All versions: 

!jsAllversions.png|thumbnail!
!jsdAllversions.png|thumbnail!

Notice that you only see the option to click "Already have JIRA software or JIRA core" if you click All versions. 


*Suggestion:*

It should have the same link persist on both screens "Already have JIRA software or JIRA core" and optionally the suggested method of [JIRA service desk Upgrade task list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/server_jira+jsd_upgrade] of step 4 (ease of use of installation instead of the obr method).
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Software or JIRA for Service Desk download/installation navigation

Hey guys!

Instead of creating a ticket in the service desk portal, we often create tickets from the "Create" button (project button) in JIRA.

The problem when we do this is that the Service Desk Request Type shows up as "No Match" even though I have setup the request type in the service desk.

Example:
https://visualjazz.jira.com/projects/SJSD/queues/353/SJSD-14
 !image-2015-11-17-17-46-42-821.png|thumbnail! 

Is there any way to set this so that this happens automatically? 

Otherwise if we request participants before doing this, they do not receive the notification.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Dynamically setting "Service Desk Request Type" when creating an issue in Jira
